subject: Soccer
Organized Crime
lead_paragraph: Seven people were arrested in Italy in a crackdown on an organized crime group that is accused of trying to buy the Lazio soccer team with laundered money. The police official Gianluca Campana said that the authorities were still looking for three people, including the former Italy and New York Cosmos star Giorgio Chinaglia, who is now living in the United States. Chinaglia, 61, is accused of trying to influence the price of Lazio shares, prosecutors said in 2006. Chinaglia has said he did nothing wrong.
